Description: Base and wall sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery plate; flaring wall and double rounded moulding at edge of base; exterior: wall probably reserved; outer moulding of base glazed black (fired in part red) band, second moulding in added red; on underside two black and one red band; interior: wall reserved; large red band between two black bands at junction of base and rim; large incised palmette with alternating red and black petals on tondo.
Curator's comments: See D. Callipolitis-Feytmans, 'Evolution du plat corinthien', BCH 86 (1962) 152, no. 35, with profile in fig. 16.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.122) (Phase 1)
